title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message:
Came in with liquid at smc area, tried reballing smc, now mac boot up fine. But internal ssd not detected, so im sure not an apfs problem.
U3740 has proper voltage 3v at pin 1 3 4 6
1v at pin 2
0 volt at pin 7 and 8 with ssd connected.. 
I have tried replacing all caps at pcie data line, no shorted caps
0v on pp3v3_s0sw_ssd_flt with ssd connected, I have tried replacing u3710 and u3711.. Any advice?

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message:
"0v on pp3v3_s0sw_ssd_flt with ssd connected"
First check diode mode to ground, w/ and w/o SSD connected.
If all good, change L3700.

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: Diode mode to ground is normal 0.478 with/without ssd i havr replaced l3700.but still same

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message:
"0v on pp3v3_s0sw_ssd_flt"
Do you get the voltage now???

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: now there's 3.3 volt but still not seeing ssd

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: Clean J3700, inspect PCIE traces and caps.

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: Cleaned j3700, pcie caps has been replaced, traces is good..

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: Yeah, all ssd used is known good, i have used multiple ssd

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message:
Heat CPU with quality flux; try to burn eventually accumulated crap.
Compare diode mode readings on all PCIE data lines.

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: Indeed this board is very dusty and not clean, i have heated pch and tried wiring r1620, but still doesnt see ssd, pch fault then? ??

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message: All diode mode is approximately 0.300, except pin 2 of c3710/11/12/13 which is 0v, but i have compared with working board, measured the same so its fine

title: 820-3437 not detecting internal ssd
message:
There should still be something affected by corrosion.
Else, bad PCH...
